name: Port Keral
culture_adjustments: more cosmopolitan and multilingual than hinterland
strong merchant-guild legal autonomy vs state norms
boat-centric kinship intensified into clan-run yards
practical Sea-Tide rituals mixed into daily port rites
constraints: limited quay and storage space; seasonal backlog at high floods
harbor access controlled by guild licenses
ritual magic use constrained by scarce imported reagents and storage quotas
notes: key chokepoint for state grain and salt exports
major warehouses double as reagent-depots subject to customs inspection
apprenticeship system central to workforce and social mobility
